title: Meddler, you said Assassin items would be made melee only if ranged started using them too much.
body: When are you gunna uphold your end of the promise?

replies.body: Well, you're not wrong. I Just don't see it happening.

Tbh, either the items will be of marginal use, or they'll be gamebreaking. 

There's not a way to push the items more towards assassins without ranged wanting them because both are pure AD classes. As long as it touts pure physical damage, both will want the items. 

This means that the items either have to be weak enough that ranged prefer crit builds, or we continue with the mess we have. 

Outside of just removing the items, melee only/reduced ranged stats may be the only 'proper' way to fix this for now.
________________
The only other realistic option without making the items useless for everyone would be changing all relevant ADC abilities to magic damage.

you could find a way to adjust the scaling on assassins vs ranged casters so that the former just needs pen to do their job but the latter needs a lot more AD

somethin like that maybe

What if Assassins had abilities that scaled DIRECTLY with Lethality?

Then the Assassin items could be adjusted so they offer the same power to Lethality-Scaling champs while being less powerful for champs that only scale on AD.

The problem I see is that sometimes you dont want to build Lethality, and scaling abilities with Lethality would probably result in lower AD ratios.

Sometimes assassins want to go tankier - if they arent having problems getting kills with a snowball, or they are getting blown up before getting on a squishy target. Like GBM's Zed in a very un-Zed meta: he made it work by getting a huge lead, but also kept the lead by going Titanic/Steraks/Maw/Deadmans to stay alive in fights once he inevitably wouldnt be able to kill a single target due to Lulu and QSS (back when it removed the Deathmark).

No. Not lower AD Ratios.

The assassin items should just have less AD so that when purchased on an assassin who scales with lethality, they give their full potential damage increase.

The GBM Zed example is just an example of those items being TOO strong at the time. I watched that game, I know what went down.

Assassins should NEVER have a viable fallback option of MULTIPLE TANK ITEMS.
MAYBE Steraks is OK. MAYBE Maw is ok.
The issue is that every ounce of tankiness that an assassins buys will mitigate their balanceable weakness of being extremely squishy, relying on their maneuverability and / or stealth to survive.

Any time an assassin is able to build tank to do their job, there is a serious balance issue.
that tanky Zed build came at a time where defensive offense items were just too strong. Sterak + Maw were constantly being purchased together. Tank Fiora was at its prime at this time. The game was pretty fucked up.
wouldn't it be easier to slow the growth of lethality on ranged champs, like make them start at 50?

Again, you're not wrong, I just don't see it happening.

You're making valid points, and I want to agree and give my opinions. 
But I feel like your efforts are simply in vain right now

I would like them to make the ranged champions have a different lethality scaling. Assuming they keep the same 60% base for melees (which we know will probably get nerfed sometime) ranged could start at 40-50%. This way, actual assassins wont be shit, and adcs will be more balanced. 

Obviously my numbers arent exact and what they should be, but this is something that I feel riot can do to balance out lethality a bit more for both classes.

Short version - since I did mention the possibility before:
Quinn has access to an assassin pattern - it is not her only pattern or necessarily her best pattern, but it's definitely there. This is a cool feature of her kit that we should support in the item system. Quinn buying Duskblade to enhance that pattern is a good thing, not a bad thing (if her kit's going to have the pattern at all).

The big concern there was that it'd be an optimal choice for most Marksman playing a normal Marksman pattern. We're confident that isn't the case, so we're allowing for fringe usage for kits on the edge of assassin and marksman (Twitch, Graves, Quinn come to mind as possible users)). - riot axes when they put duskblade on pbe

However I thought a rioter did say they would look into it if its a problem, that is not a promise to make them melee only but confirmation to tweak around it.(mind you I don't remember saying to do it for nights edge and ghostblade, or pre-caulfields maw)
